content: Humans have existed for only a brief moment of the Earth's full life span.

!For Earth events, see Canup and Asphaug [moon_origin], Chow [african_rift], Hoffman et al. [snowball], Kasting [kasting], Li et al. (2008) [rodinia], Mathewson [solar_eclipse], O'Malley-James et al. [swansong], Perlman [hawaii_future], Scotese [pannotia], Ward and Brownlee [rare_earth], Wit [vaalbara], Zhao et al. [columbia_sc], and Zubritsky [ur].

!For Life events, see Bell et al. [life_origin1], Bengtson et al. [fungi], Butterfield [sex_origin], Franck et al. [biosphere_extinction], Li et al. (2009) [oceans_end], Luhmann et al. [luhmann], Lyons et al. [oxygen], Ohtomo et al. [life_origin2].

!For Animals events, see Cunningham et al. [first_animals], Normile [first_trees], O'Malley-James et al. [swansong], Rubenstein et al. [first_plants], Ward [earth_fate], and our review of Earth's mass extinctions. For Hominid events, see Berna et al. [controlled_fire], Haile-Selassie [australopithecus], and Harmand et al. [stone_tools]. For homo sapiens events, see Bar-Yosef [behavioral_modernity] and Schlebusch et al. [sapiens].
!Potential future events are discussed in AI Multiple [agi_date], Kimball [designer_baby_date], Li and Zhao [bci_date], O'Neill [oneill_date], and Reedy [mars_date], and our population analysis.

!Far future events are discussed in the Coffey [ls_coffey], Department of the Interior [badlands], IPCC [ipcc_irreverse], Frölicher [ncc_stoppage], MIT [mit_asteroid], Niagara Parks [niagara_falls], Stager [next_ice_age].
!References for other events are readily found in reference materials.
A PDF version of this exhibit is also available.
